```{r libraries, message = FALSE}

library(rlist)
```

lrdb_pre_annotation_001 was initially derived from lrdb_005 but to 
prevent problems due to potential changes of lrdb_005 the manual annotations
will be added using a static lrdb_pre_annotation_001.rds that will not be 
changed anymore.
If lrdb_005 is changed significantly, the rows altered in this script should
be added differently.
DO NOT CHANGE lrdb_pre_annotation_001.rds !!!!!!! 
ALL MANUAL ANNOTATIONS ARE BASED ON THIS NOW !!!!!!!

```{r checkpoint3_load, message = FALSE}

lrdb <- list.load(file = "../../data/databases/lrdb_pre_annotation_001.rds")

```

# Add Manual Annotations

These manual annotations are derived from Adrien's help and from Uniprot website

```{r display_interactions, message = FALSE}

empty_pos <- which(lrdb$interactions$interaction_type == "")
length(empty_pos)
nrow(lrdb$interactions[lrdb$interactions$interaction_type == "",])
lrdb$interactions[empty_pos,]

```

General rules for manual annotations

- all interactions with ligands that are Membrane bound are designated as 
membrane

- all interactions with ligands that are classically secreted are designated as 
Secreted

- all interactions with ligands that are secreted as ECM components are 
designated as ECM

- In cases, both membrane bound or secreted interactions are possible, these
are designated as Both

- Interactions to be removed are designated as TBR and will be removed in
a later step.

one type of annotation.
Types of Annotation:

- Secreted

- ECM

- Membrane

- ECM, Membrane

- ECM, Membrane, Secreted

- ECM, Secreted

- Membrane, Secreted

- Other (from RNA Magnet)

# Annotate non-shared Ligands/Receptors

I have realized o late that it would have been more convenient to
do this before all manual annotations, but now it's too late unless I want
to change all annotations again.

Instead, I will use an older version to add the lost info again by rbind.

Some genes were previously discarded because they were not found in 
insp_ref_shared.
Some of these may be important though, so these will be manually annotated
and also added to insp_ref_shared and insp_ref.

```{r}

insp_ref <- list.load(file= "../../data/databases/insp_ref_comp.rds")
insp_ref_shared <- list.load(file= "../../data/databases/insp_ref_shared.rds")

# Load an old version of lrdb that still contains these genes
lrdb_old <- list.load(file = "../../data/databases/lrdb_004.rds")

```

Add the ligand and receptor rows to insp_ref_shared

```{r add_to_shared, message = FALSE}

# make a list to add by rbind 
# start with ligs and add the recs
insp_ref_add_shared <- insp_ref_add_ligs
insp_ref_add_shared$ids <- rbind(insp_ref_add_shared$ids,
                                 insp_ref_add_recs$ids) 
insp_ref_add_shared$gene_names <- rbind(insp_ref_add_shared$gene_names,
                                 insp_ref_add_recs$gene_names) 
insp_ref_add_shared$synonyms <- rbind(insp_ref_add_shared$synonyms,
                                 insp_ref_add_recs$synonyms) 
insp_ref_add_shared$metadata <- rbind(insp_ref_add_shared$metadata,
                                 insp_ref_add_recs$metadata) 
nrow(insp_ref_add_shared$ids)
# a total of 38 ligands and receptor rows can be added

# remove duplicates because some of these receptors may also be ligands
# and vice versa
insp_ref_add_shared$gene_names <- insp_ref_add_shared$gene_names[
  duplicated(insp_ref_add_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id) == FALSE,]

insp_ref_add_shared$synonyms <- insp_ref_add_shared$synonyms[
  duplicated(insp_ref_add_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id) == FALSE,]

insp_ref_add_shared$metadata <- insp_ref_add_shared$metadata[
  duplicated(insp_ref_add_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id) == FALSE,]

insp_ref_add_shared$ids <- insp_ref_add_shared$ids[
  duplicated(insp_ref_add_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id) == FALSE,]
nrow(insp_ref_add_shared$ids)
# still 38 left, apparently no duplicates

# now add the receptors to be added to insp_ref_shared
nrow(insp_ref_shared$ids)
insp_ref_shared$ids <- rbind(insp_ref_shared$ids, 
                             insp_ref_add_shared$ids)
insp_ref_shared$gene_names <- rbind(insp_ref_shared$gene_names, 
                             insp_ref_add_shared$gene_names)
insp_ref_shared$synonyms <- rbind(insp_ref_shared$synonyms, 
                             insp_ref_add_shared$synonyms)
insp_ref_shared$metadata <- rbind(insp_ref_shared$metadata, 
                             insp_ref_add_shared$metadata)
nrow(insp_ref_shared$ids)
```

```{r remove_nonanno, message = FALSE}
               insp_ref_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id)),]
lrdb_add_both$ligands <- lrdb_add_both$ligands[
  !is.na(match(lrdb_add_both$interactions$receptor_ensembl_id,
               insp_ref_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id)),]
lrdb_add_both$receptors <- lrdb_add_both$receptors[
  !is.na(match(lrdb_add_both$interactions$receptor_ensembl_id,
               insp_ref_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id)),]
lrdb_add_both$interactions <- lrdb_add_both$interactions[
  !is.na(match(lrdb_add_both$interactions$receptor_ensembl_id,
               insp_ref_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id)),]

# check again if all new LRI are in insp_ref_shared
table(is.na(match(lrdb_add_both$interactions$ligand_ensembl_id,
                  insp_ref_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id,)))
table(is.na(match(lrdb_add_both$interactions$receptor_ensembl_id,
                  insp_ref_shared$ids$ensembl_mbl6_id,)))
# now all rows have r and l that are part of insp_ref_shared and can be added
```
